title: The X Factor's Eoghan Quigg showcases dramatic transformation 11 years after his TV debut
text:
He rose to fame on The X Factor at the tender age of 16 as the baby-faced singer from Northern Ireland.

And Eoghan Quigg looks a far cry from his from his younger self as gone is the cute spiky-haired warbler he was once known as, and in his place is a tattooed hunk.

His look isn't the only thing that is different, as Eoghan's career has significantly changed, as he also now works as a radio presenter and footballer.

Transformation: Eoghan Quigg looks a far cry from his from his younger self as gone is the cute spiky-haired warbler he was once known as, and in his place is a tattooed hunk

Eoghan placed third on the show in 2008, finishing behind JLS and eventual winner year of Alexandra Burke.

And in good news for fans, Eoghan still works as a singer, but he also has new career passions in life.

As a footballer, he joined Coagh United F.C. in 2015, before moving on to Portstewart F.C. in the Northern Ireland Intermediate League.

He also works as a presenter for Q Radio, where he presents a segment called #QuiggOnQ.

The way he was: He rose to fame on The X Factor at the tender age of 16 as the baby-faced singer from Northern Ireland

Changes: His look isn't the only thing that is different, as Eoghan's career has significantly changed, as he also now works as a radio presenter and footballer

Discussing his radio gig, he said recently: 'The best thing for me is that no two shows are the same, there's always something different which keeps it fresh and that’s what I love.

'I also enjoy the banter with Q Radio listeners.'

X Factor viewers will now doubt remember the Irish lad for his super young appearance and spiky blonde hair.

Baby face: Eoghan placed third on the show in 2008, finishing behind JLS and eventual winner year of Alexandra Burke

Discussing his time on Simon Cowell's flagship show: During a This Morning interview in 2016, Eoghan said: 'I was 16 at the time, I was still a kid, I was still in school'

But these days he rocks a smarter brunette haircut, bulging muscles and a sleeve of tattoos.

In his home life, Eoghan and his stunning girlfriend Amy Campbell recently brought their first house together, and celebrated their anniversary.

Discussing his time on Simon Cowell's flagship show, during a This Morning interview in 2016, Eoghan said: 'I was 16 at the time, I was still a kid, I was still in school.

Happy couple: In his home life, Eoghan and his stunning girlfriend Amy recently brought their first house together, and celebrated their anniversary

'It was a big change for me, but one of the best experiences of my life.'

'I moved back and did the whole education thing [after the show], I went to uni and now I'm back after my break, gigging.'

Eoghan famously enjoyed a romance with fellow X Factor star Diana Vickers, branding their fleeting liaison 'the best experience' of his life.
description: The X Factor's Eoghan Quigg, 27, showcases his dramatic transformation 11 years after his TV debut... as singer is now a hunky radio presenter and footballer
